awd_titl_txt: Minority Graduate Assistantship in Chemistry - Todd J.      Martinez
awd_abstract_narration: Todd J. Martinez has been awarded a Minority Graduate                         Assistantship in Chemistry.  The Minority Graduate                              Assistantships in Chemistry are viewed as an infrastructural                    investment designed to broaden the participation, knowledge,                    and experience of students who are members of minority groups                   underrepresented in Chemistry, and attract them into meaningful                 careers in chemical research and teaching.                                      %%%                                                                             Mr. Martinez has a B.S. degree from Calvin College and is                       currently in the Ph.D. program at UCLA in the area of                           Theoretical Chemistry.  His research adviser, Prof. Emily                       Carter, writes that he has worked out the equations to do the                   configuration interaction problem using Friesner's                              pseudospectral method. In his proposed plan of research he                      describes the Monte Carlo calculations of the electronic                        structure of iron dimer.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
